title: Analyzing behavior of function from graph

content.question: The graph of f is shown in the figure above. Which of the following could be the graph of derivative of f ?

choices.label: A graph plots a wave shaped curve that originates from the point a comma 0, rises to a maximum point in the second quadrant, falls to a minimum point in the fourth quadrant, and further rises to the point b comma 0.

A graph plots a curve that originates in the second quadrant at a point with x equals a. The curve falls down to the negative x axis at a point between the coordinates a comma 0 and the origin. The curve rises as an arc and falls down to the positive x axis at a point between the origin and the ordered pair b comma 0. The curve further to a point in the third quadrant with x equals b.

A graph plots a wave shaped curve that originates from the point a comma 0, falls to a minimum point in the third quadrant, rises to a maximum point in the first quadrant, and further falls to the point b comma 0.

A graph plots an inverse bell shaped curve. The curve originates in the second quadrant with x equals a, falls to a minimum point in the fourth quadrant, and ends in the first quadrant with x equals b.

A graph plots a line that originates in the second quadrant with x equals a, decreases gradually as it moves to the right. The line passes through the positive y axis and positive x axis, and ends in the fourth quadrant with x equals b.

content.answer: A graph plots a wave shaped curve that originates from the point a comma 0, rises to a maximum point in the second quadrant, falls to a minimum point in the fourth quadrant, and further rises to the point b comma 0.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
